title: First-time buyer challenges minister over 10.4% mortgage offer
description: A first-time buyer tells BBC One's Question Time four mortgage offers were withdrawn after market turmoil.

title: Morocco demands Adidas changes Algeria football kit
description: Adidas says an Algerian palace inspired the design, but Morocco says it is cultural appropriation.

title: Cost of living: Energy bills set to rise but help cushions blow
description: A two-year government-set cap means price rises taking effect on Saturday are lower than initially expected.

title: US points finger at Russia over gas pipeline sabotage
description: US Energy Secretary Jennifer Granholm tells the BBC its unlikely Nord Stream leaks are coincidence.

title: The Papers: 'PM holds crunch talks' and benefits to be curbed
description: Liz Truss's efforts to reassure the markets that she can control government spending lead the papers.

title: Finland wants to transform how we make clothes
description: Firms behind innovative fibres says they can make fashion a more sustainable business.

title: King Charles: New coins featuring monarch's portrait unveiled
description: Centuries of tradition are followed as King Charles faces left - the opposite way to the Queen.

title: Cost of living tips: How to cut energy and heating costs in your home
description: Consumer Affairs Correspondent Colletta Smith has picked out some of the best ways to cut costs in your home.

title: Energy price cap: Three things to do before your bills rise

title: Olivia Pratt-Korbel: Murder arrest over Liverpool shooting
description: A 34-year-old man is held on suspicion of murder after the killing of Olivia Pratt-Korbel.

title: Liz Truss to attend first meeting of European nations club
description: More than 40 leaders, including from all the EU states, were invited to discuss security and energy issues.

title: Ukraine-Russia war: US army doctor and wife charged with Russia spying
description: The army major doctor and her wife, a civilian doctor, are charged over plans to leak health information.

title: Mini-budget: PM to meet head of OBR following market turmoil
description: Liz Truss and the Chancellor Kwasi Kwarteng will meet the independent forecaster the OBR on Friday.

title: Everton 1-0 Leicester: Toffees beat Leicester with late own goal in WSL
description: An own goal by goalkeeper Kirstie Levell deep in stoppage time gives Everton victory over Leicester City in the Women's Super League.

title: Alfred Dunhill Links: Romain Langasque equals Old Course record to lead
description: Romain Langasque says he will remember equalling the Old Course record to lead the Alfred Dunhill Links Championship "for the rest of my life".

title: Transgender charity Mermaids under investigation
description: The Charity Commission is investigating concerns over safeguarding.

title: Rugby League World Cup: Jonny Lomax and Mark Percival ruled out of England squad
description: St Helens duo Jonny Lomax and Mark Percival are ruled out of England's 24-man squad for the World Cup because of injury concerns.

title: Men jailed for murder of friend killed by rival gang in shootout
description: Jurors heard they fired knowing rivals would shoot back, in what is thought to be a landmark case.

title: County Championship: Liam Norwell takes 9-62 as Warwickshire beat Hampshire to relegate Yorkshire
description: Liam Norwell takes a stunning 9-62 as Warwickshire beat Hampshire by five runs to send Yorkshire down.

title: West Brom women change shorts colour to navy because of period concerns
description: West Bromwich Albion women will wear navy shorts because of concerns about having to wear white while on their periods.

title: Liz Truss interviews: Five key exchanges with prime minister

description: The prime minister was asked about her plans during a series of BBC local radio interviews.

title: Young non-smokers told not to take up vaping by experts
description: But the findings do show that vaping is far safer than cigarettes, so smokers should switch.

title: PGA Tour launches LIV Golf lawsuit counterclaim
description: The PGA Tour launches a counterclaim lawsuit against the Saudi-backed LIV Golf series, saying it enticed players to breach contracts and help 'sportswash' the nation's human rights record.

title: Rory McIlroy: World number two rejects criticism of caddie Harry Diamond
description: Rory McIlroy strongly defends his caddie Harry Diamond, saying that their record together "speaks for itself".

title: Hurricane Ian - Maps and images showing destruction

description: Exam results in 2023 will be much closer to pre-Covid levels after a boom in top grades, Ofqual says.

title: Harry Dunn crash: US citizen appears in court
description: Anne Sacoolas is accused of causing death by dangerous driving following a collision in 2019.

title: Renee MacRae: Man found guilty of killing lover and son in 1976
description: The bodies of Renee MacRae and her three-year-old son Andrew have never been found.

title: Covid vulnerable not always assessed by NHS 111 early in pandemic

title: Dover summer queue warning under new EU border system

title: Russia to formally annex four more areas of Ukraine
description: Russia is to press ahead with annexation days after conducting unrecognised referendums.

description: Police say nobody was seriously injured in the incident outside an airbase.

title: Next warns weaker pound could prolong cost of living pressures

title: Cancer charity boss put donations into Welsh dragon plan
description: The foundation made no charitable donations by the time it closed, and the dragon was never built.

description: European champions England will play their final two games of 2022 against Japan and Norway in November.

title: Hurricane Ian: Cities flooded and power cut as storm crosses Florida
description: Some 2.2 million homes are without electricity after 241km/h (150mph) winds tore down power lines.

title: GFSN League: 20 years of LGBTQ+ league whose aim is not to exist

title: Coolio: Gangsta's Paradise rapper dead at 59
description: The artist's manager says he was found unresponsive in a friend's bathroom.

title: The long-misdiagnosed student heading to Cambridge to study medicine

title: Windsor Castle: Public can visit Queen's final resting place in St George's Chapel
description: The Queen was buried with Prince Philip and alongside the remains of her father, mother and sister.

title: Energy bills: Householders urged to read meters before October price rise
description: The average annual household energy bill in the UK will rise from £1,971 to £2,500.
